result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Josue D. Flores

records.addlTxt:
2:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Josue D. Flores in court.  Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz in court for Josue D. Flores. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Attorney Schwarz states the matter is resolved, but the agreement with the State is contingent upon the DE attending anger management. Attorney Schwarz is requesting an adjournment to allow the DE to complete anger management. The State does not object. Court adjourns.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Due to court's unavailability, JPT adj from 9/14 to 10/4; confirming email sent to attys
Judicial Pretrial - in court on October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Josue D. Flores
Current: 2014 Slauson Avenue, Racine, WI 53403-2155 United States  (Effective: 09-12-2022)
Prior: 720 Washington Road, Kenosha, WI 53143 United States
finance notified

Defendant, Josue D. Flores, appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
